results.title: Lella Smith interview with Emma McRae [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Lella Smith is the Creative Director of the Walt Disney Animation and Research Library and curator of the ‘Dreams Come True: The Art of Disney’s Classic Fairytales’ exhibition. In this interview, Emma McRae, ACMI Exhibitions Curator, speaks to Lella about how the exhibition came about and the enormous task of selecting the films and items for exhibition from Disney’s vast archives.

results.title: Leisure time photography
results.brief_description: Professional photographer Freeman Patterson describes photography as a hobby that provides people not only with a creative outlet, but actually improves their ability to appreciate their surroundings. Shows him teaching students his beliefs and techniques.

results.title: Leisure lines
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and New Films
results.brief_description: Leisure and recreation are becoming increasingly important to people in the community. Its important that there be some physical side to it and also enjoyment and relaxation. In addition, as this film points out, good facilities and community organisations are required to help people make the most of their leisuretime. Produced for the South Australian Department of Tourism, Recreation and Sport.

results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
In this second episode we are introduced to simple vocabulary associated with leisure activities and the phrases “Do you like?”, “What do you like?”, “How many times?” as well as vocabulary associated with weather and family members. The calligraphy section shows words which include “ball”, eg. “football”, “volleyball”, etc. The program concludes with two short dramatised situations “The TV addict” and “The Picnic” in which a Chinese couple are introduced to the joys of the Australian barbecue. In Mandarin and English.

results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A fast-paced, humorous film, animated by Bruce Petty. The film emphasises the use of leisure time as an important aspect of life in our society. Planning for recreation and leisure time should be undertaken both on a personal and a broad public level. (Awards: Winner of the 1976 American Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film)

results.title: Leila [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Dariush Mehrjui, Faramarz Farazmand and Farabi Cinema Foundation
results.brief_description: Considered as the founder of modern Iranian cinema, one of Iran’s greatest modern directors (alongside Kiarostami and Makmalbaf) and that country’s “longest-running cinematic master”, Dariush Mehrjui lacks the international profile of his contemporaries. “Leila” is one of just a handful of his films that have achieved recognition and distribution outside of Iran. Set firmly in the urban world of contemporary middle-class Tehran, the film centres on besotted newlywed couple Leila and Reza. Their happy life together begins to unravel after Leila finds herself unable to conceive. While the couple are unconcerned about this development, Reza’s mother is determined that her son have children, and insists that he must take a second wife to produce a heir and continue the family line. When Reza refuses to give in to her demands she turns to Leila, beating down her resistance to the idea with a mix of pleading, haranguing, and lies, until the couple limply gives in. An understated, yet devastating story of a happy union destroyed by the pressures of family and tradition. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Legs, leglessness, and locomotion
results.creator_credit: David Stammer, Bank of New South Wales and Kinatura Films
results.brief_description: Closely looks at aspects of legs, leglessness and locomotion in Monitor Lizards, and confirms the widely held belief that snakes share their ancestry. Also suggests the probability that all snakes once possessed legs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Stammer, Bank of New South Wales and Kinatura Films

results.title: Legs
results.creator_credit: Jerrold Freedman, Ron Parker, Franklin R. Levy, Comworld Productions, Radio City Music Hall Productions and Catalina productions
results.brief_description: Three young hopefuls, Terry (Deborah Geffner), Melissa (Maureen Teefy) and Lisa (Shanna Reed) aspire to become part of the The Radio City Music Hall Rockettes, one of the world’s most famous and glamorous chorus lines. The story revolves around their auditioning, their hard work, successes and failures and of course their romances. Cast also includes John Heard, Sheree North, David Marshall Grant and Gwen Verdon.
